title: From a Mexican cartel to the streets of New York: A deep dive into the business of fentanyl
summary: For two years, Bertrand Monnet, an expert in the economics of crime, filmed every stage of the Sinaloa cartel's business model in Mexico. In this second episode of Narco Business, Le Monde looks into the cartel's well-oiled organization for selling fentanyl.

title: 'The temptation exists among EU member states to abandon the Israeli-Palestinian front in favor of the war in Ukraine'
summary: Some EU members are inclined to let Washington shoulder its responsibilities on Israel's side while focusing their attention on the commitment to Kyiv, according to journalist Philippe Ricard.

title: Pedro Sanchez's risky gamble
summary: The Spanish socialist was reelected as prime minister by MPs, at the cost of an amnesty promised to the organizers of the disputed 2017 independence referendum. With this pact, he risks losing what political credit he has left.

title: Israel allows fuel delivery into Gaza to restore phone links
summary: Israel's war cabinet approved supplying two tankers of fuel daily, responding to Washington's request. On Friday, 17,000 liters of fuel entered Gaza via the Rafah crossing, as confirmed by a Palestinian border official.

title: ChatGPT-maker Open AI fires CEO Sam Altman
summary: The San Francisco-based AI company stated in an official announcement on Friday that Altman was 'not consistently candid in his communications'.

title: Inuit singer Elisapie's reverse 'cultural appropriation'
summary: The singer-songwriter, currently on tour in France, has undertaken to cover hits from the 1970s and 1980s in her mother tongue, Inuktitut. A reappropriation of these words by 'White people' for her own people.

title: French senator charged for allegedly drugging MP with intent to commit rape
summary: Sandrine Josso filed a complaint against Senator Joël Guerriau after she said she felt strange after accepting a drink on Tuesday night at his home.

title: Senegal's highest court blocks opposition leader Sonko from presidential run
summary: Senegal's supreme court overturned a decision that would have reinstated him to Senegal's voter rolls, effectively barring him from running in February 2024 elections.

title: 4 takeways from awaited French report on protecting minors from incest and sexual violence
summary: The dedicated commission's final report contains 82 recommendations drawn from nearly 30,000 testimonies of victims of abuse as children.

title: French Oscar pick 'The Taste of Things:' An indigestible pot-au-feu
summary: Tran Anh Hung's highly academic film about gastronomy and the art of living has been chosen to represent France at the Oscars in March 2024.

title: White House condemns Musk's 'abhorrent promotion' of anti-Semitism
summary: The owner of social media X on Wednesday replied to a post considering that Jewish people encourage 'hatred against whites' saying it was 'the actual truth'.

title: How 'The Crown' has benefited the British royal family's image
summary: The sixth and final season of the series, available since November 16 on Netflix, features the Windsors in a far more glamorous and flattering way than the British tabloids.

title: Escalation persists on the border between Lebanon and Israel
summary: The scope and intensity of the fighting between Hezbollah and the Israeli army are escalating, surpassing the designated 5-kilometer zone on both sides of the demarcation line.

title: US avoids budget crisis, at the expense of Ukraine and Israel
summary: The plan, devised by the new Republican speaker of the House of Representatives, staved off a shutdown, but postpones the passage of aid for Washington's allies until 2024.

title: Tesla Model 3 adopts new look and features in hopes of boosting demand
summary: With 2 million units produced, this car, launched in 2019, has seen its sales decline.

title: Author, critic, and poet A.S. Byatt dies aged 87
summary: The novelist and short-story writer won the 1990 Booker Prize, as well as many other accolades for her 24 novels and works of criticism. She was made a dame in 1999.

title: Macron argues against 'punitive' AI regulation
summary: The French President, in a nod to the EU's upcoming AI Act, warned against restrictive Artificial Intelligence laws, in order to 'preserve innovation.'

title: Macron acknowledges European splits on Israel-Hamas war
summary: Pro-Palestinian protesters demonstrated against the French president's stance on the war in Gaza during his state visit to Switzerland.

title: European regulation on artificial intelligence threatened by stalled negotiations
summary: France, supported by Germany and Italy, is opposed to regulating large-scale AI models if their use is not 'risky.' This stance has drawn accusations of playing into the hands of tech lobbyists.

title: Rik Devillé, the retired Belgian priest crusading against sexual abuse in the Church
summary: A recent television documentary stirred political attention by showcasing numerous testimonies collected over three decades by the ex-parish priest of Buizingen in Flanders.

title: Liberia: Outgoing president George Weah concedes defeat to Joseph Boakai
summary: Elections officials said that with 99.5% of ballots counted from Tuesday's election, Boakai was in the lead, with 50.89% to Weah's 49.11%.

title: Marine Le Pen's self-proclaimed Gaullist credentials have not stood up to the war in Gaza
summary: After Hamas attacked Israel, the leader of the French far right claimed she was strictly following Charles de Gaulle's doctrine. But her rejection of Islam prevents her from endorsing policies inspired by the former president's record in the region.

title: New Delhi's air pollution crisis is poisoning millions of children every winter
summary: Faced with a toxic cloud enveloping the Indian capital for several days, the authorities ordered the closure of schools on November 3.

title: A photographer's Whatsapp conversation tells the story of daily life in Gaza
summary: WhatsApp messages to fellow photographers from Sameh-Nidal Rahmi, trapped in the besieged Gaza Strip, tell of terror and heartbreak under Israeli bombardment.

title: Argentina presidential campaign neglects environmental issues
summary: At a time when the country is bearing the full brunt of the consequences of climate change, one of the two candidates, the far-right Javier Milei, is openly climate-skeptical.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs and singer Cassie settle lawsuit 1 day after it was filed
summary: The lawsuit against the musician and producer accused him of rape and over a decade of alleged coercion through physical force and drugs.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Tahiti surf venue maintained with smaller tower after backlash
summary: The construction of a metal judges' tower had caused opposition due to concerns over its effects on the local environment. Organizers have decided to reduce the size of the new tower to match the size of the old one.
